p: A targeting strategy that focuses the majority of resources on a single group is not an acceptable strategy due to the ethical issues of potentially leaving a proportion of the population without access to care. Of the five “non-random” strategies in Fig 3, the percentage of the HIV+ population initiating suppressive therapy at the start of the TasP campaign that was not a member of a target group was highest under the “under age 25” and “under age 30” strategies ( Fig 3D).
